title: Tour de France 2021 Standings after Stage 19
content:
General Classification / Yellow Jersey 

Stage 19 was a day for the breakaway, all GC contenders finished over 20 minutes down on eventual stage winner Matej Mohoric. This means that the top 10 in the fight for the yellow jersey remains the same ahead of one final possible shake-up in tomorrow's time trial.

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Jonas Vingegaard +5:39
3. Richard Carapaz +5:43
4. Ben O'Connor +8:18
5. Wilco Kelderman +8:50
6. Enric Mas +10:11
7. Alexey Lutsenko +11:22
8. Guillaume Martin +12:46
9. Pello Bilbao +13:48
10. Rigoberto Uran +16:25

Tour de France 2021 Guide

Points Classification / Green Jersey

Michael Matthews picked up a further 9 points in in today's intermediate sprint, edging slightly closer to Cavendish. However, no sprint finish meant that the big points on the line were swept up by the breakaway. The final fight for Green will commence on the Champs-Elysees on Sunday.

1. Mark Cavendish - 304 points
2. Michael Matthews - 269 points
3. Sonny Colbrelli - 216 points
4. Jasper Philipsen - 186 points
5. Matej Mohoric - 163 points

The Tour de France jerseys – the race so far

King of the Mountains Classification / Polka-Dot Jersey

After his wins in the mountain stages so far, Pogacar is now unreachable in the Mountain Classification. As long as he finishes the race, Pogacar will win the KOM jersey for the second year in a row.

1. Tadej Pogacar - 107 points
2. Wout Poels - 88 points
3. Jonas Vingegaard - 82 points
4. Wout van Aert - 72 points
5. Nairo Quintana - 68 points

Young Rider's Classification / White Jersey

The White Jersey competition remains the same after all contenders finished in the main bunch.

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Jonas Vingegaard +5:45
3. David Gaudu +18:42
4.  Aurélien Paret-Peintre +37:21
5. Sergio Higuita +1:03:01

Team Classification

1. Bahrain Victorious
2. EF Education-Nippo +23:25
3. Team Jumbo Visma +1:15:32
4. INEOS Grenadiers +1:30:06
5. AG2R Citroen Team +1:30:41
